title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Boston Celtics lost 123-110 to the Orlando Magic, with Jaylen Brown scoring 32 points on 15-for-28 shooting.
The Celtics' defense struggled, allowing 38 and 39 points in the first and fourth quarters, respectively, to the Magic.
Payton Pritchard improved his shooting, hitting 5-for-8 from three-point range, contributing 27 points in the loss.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph faces public reprimand for creating 'appearance of impropriety' in a 2018 ICE evasion case.
A hearing officer stated Joseph was unaware of the defendant's escape plan but unintentionally violated court protocol.
Federal charges against Joseph were dropped in 2022; she was initially charged in 2019 for alleged obstruction of justice.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Cora remains optimistic about the Red Sox's future despite their playoff elimination by the Yankees last month.
Key roster changes include Trevor Story opting in, Alex Bregman opting out, and Lucas Giolito missing a qualifying offer.
Cora highlighted the team's valuable postseason experience and believes they are trending in the right direction.

title: Giant blade breaks off Mass. wind turbine
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A turbine blade detached and fell into a cranberry bog in Plymouth, Massachusetts, without causing injuries.
The 75-100 foot blade was several hundred feet from the turbine's base off Head of the Bay Road.
The turbine shut down in 'fail-safe mode'; investigation by MassDEP and Inspectional Services is ongoing.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: "The Fantastic Four: First Steps" offers a new adaptation of Marvel's superhero family, streaming on Disney+.
"Frankenstein" by Guillermo del Toro presents a reimagined tale focusing on the monster, now available on Netflix.
"Materialists," a romcom satire with Dakota Johnson and Pedro Pascal, is streaming on HBO Max.

title: Stefon Diggs reveals what he’s trying to improve about himself after 11 years in the NFL
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Stefon Diggs aims to improve his attitude, acknowledging a tendency to get frustrated and seek perfection.
Diggs leads Patriots in receiving stats this season with 508 yards and 45 receptions over nine games.
He praises Patriots' coaches for fostering a supportive environment, contributing to the team's offensive success.

title: Commuter train plows through car on tracks in Acton
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: An MBTA commuter train hit an empty car on the tracks at Central Street, Acton, Thursday evening; no injuries reported.
The car's driver exited after bypassing a closed gate; the vehicle was pushed 300 feet by the train.
Fitchburg Line commuters faced delays; Transit Police issued the driver a citation and are investigating.

title: What to know about possible Red Sox free agent target Munetaka Murakami after posting
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Munetaka Murakami, a top NPB hitter, has been posted for MLB; he played for Tokyo Yakult Swallows.
The 25-year-old Japanese slugger, with 142 home runs, is a free agent target for the Red Sox.
Red Sox are among potential teams interested, with Murakami expected to draw an $16.9M posting fee.

title: Airlines are waiving fees, offering refunds due to reduced flight schedules
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: FAA reduced flights by 10% at 40 airports, including Logan, due to the government shutdown.
Airlines like JetBlue, Southwest, and United are waiving fees and offering refunds for affected travelers.
Travelers are advised to check with airlines for rebooking or refunds due to expected delays and cancellations.

title: After Cape Cod crash, readers say Mass. should tighten e-bike regulations
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: A Cape Cod e-bike crash has led to calls for stricter regulations in Massachusetts, with safety cited as a major concern.
Lynne Forester, injured on Cape Cod Rail Trail, argues that Massachusetts needs tougher e-bike rules to protect pedestrians.
78% of Boston.com readers support stronger e-bike regulations, highlighting the growing popularity and safety concerns of these vehicles.
